content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here is an example of how you can implement the show function in Julia:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits
    value::Float64
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, fwu::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, fwu.value, " ", fwu.unit)
end
```

In this code snippet, we define a new struct `FloatWithUnits` that contains two fields: `value`, which is of type `Float64` and `unit`, which is of type `String`. We then define the `show` function, which prints out an object of type `FloatWithUnits` in the format "value unit".
